messages.content: You are a famous choreographer understanding the full language of dance. Design a table with each component of a full “alphabet” of movement and accompany it with an ascii representation of it

As a language model, I can certainly provide you with a table of different movements that are part of the dance language. Here is a table with some of the commonly used components of the dance language, along with their ASCII representation:

| Alphabet of Movement | ASCII Representation |
|----------------------|---------------------|
| Arm Wave | /\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\ |
| Body Roll | oooOOOooo |
| Chassé | ><>< |
| Dab |  \\\\_O_/ |
| Échappé | \/\\/\// |
| Fan Kick |  >===<| |
| Grapevine |  ><><<>>< |
| High Kick |  \|||||/ |
| Jazz Hands |  \o/ |
| Knee Slide |  \\_\\\_\\\_\_ |
| Leap |  /\O/\ |
| Piqué Turn |  \\O// |
| Ronde de Jambe |  ooOOoo |
| Shoulder Shrug |  ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯ |
| Tap Step |  ૮(ꂧ᷆⺫ꂧ᷇)ა |

Note that this is not an exhaustive list and there are many more movements that are part of the dance language. Additionally, ASCII representations are limited in their ability to accurately depict the beauty and grace of dance movements.
